name: Data Types

params.name: type
params.description:
Required. If the type is not set or is TYPE_UNSPECIFIED, returns an INVALID_ARGUMENT error.

The number should be among the values of Type Type

params.name: content
params.description: The content of the input in string format.

params.name: gcsContentUri
params.description: The Google Cloud Storage URI where the file content is located. This URI must be of the form: gs://bucket_name/object_name. For more details, see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/reference-uris. NOTE: Cloud Storage object versioning is not supported.

params.name: language
params.description: The language of the document (if not specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Language Support lists currently supported languages for each API method. If the language (either specified by the caller or automatically detected) is not supported by the called API method, an INVALID_ARGUMENT error is returned.

methods.name: Type
methods.description: The document types enum.

methods.name: Sentence
methods.description: Represents a sentence in the input document.

params.name: text
params.description:
The sentence text.

This object should have the same structure as TextSpan TextSpan

params.name: sentiment
params.description:
For calls to {@link AnalyzeSentiment} or if {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment} is set to true, this field will contain the sentiment for the sentence.

This object should have the same structure as Sentiment Sentiment

methods.name: Entity
methods.description: Represents a phrase in the text that is a known entity, such as a person, an organization, or location. The API associates information, such as salience and mentions, with entities.

params.name: name
params.description: The representative name for the entity.

params.name: type
params.description:
The entity type.

The number should be among the values of Type Type

params.name: metadata
params.description:
Metadata associated with the entity.

Currently, Wikipedia URLs and Knowledge Graph MIDs are provided, if available. The associated keys are "wikipedia_url" and "mid", respectively.

params.name: salience
params.description:
The salience score associated with the entity in the [0, 1.0] range.

The salience score for an entity provides information about the importance or centrality of that entity to the entire document text. Scores closer to 0 are less salient, while scores closer to 1.0 are highly salient.

params.name: mentions
params.description:
The mentions of this entity in the input document. The API currently supports proper noun mentions.

This object should have the same structure as EntityMention EntityMention

params.name: sentiment
params.description:
For calls to {@link AnalyzeEntitySentiment} or if {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entity_sentiment} is set to true, this field will contain the aggregate sentiment expressed for this entity in the provided document.

This object should have the same structure as Sentiment Sentiment

methods.name: Token
methods.description: Represents the smallest syntactic building block of the text.

params.name: text
params.description:
The token text.

This object should have the same structure as TextSpan TextSpan

params.name: partOfSpeech
params.description:
Parts of speech tag for this token.

This object should have the same structure as PartOfSpeech PartOfSpeech

params.name: dependencyEdge
params.description:
Dependency tree parse for this token.

This object should have the same structure as DependencyEdge DependencyEdge

params.name: lemma
params.description: Lemma of the token.

methods.name: Sentiment
methods.description: Represents the feeling associated with the entire text or entities in the text.

params.name: magnitude
params.description: A non-negative number in the [0, +inf) range, which represents the absolute magnitude of sentiment regardless of score (positive or negative).

params.name: score
params.description: Sentiment score between -1.0 (negative sentiment) and 1.0 (positive sentiment).

methods.name: PartOfSpeech
methods.description: Represents part of speech information for a token. Parts of speech are as defined in http://www.lrec-conf.org/proceedings/lrec2012/pdf/274_Paper.pdf

params.name: tag
params.description:
The part of speech tag.

The number should be among the values of Tag Tag

params.name: aspect
params.description:
The grammatical aspect.

The number should be among the values of Aspect Aspect

params.name: case
params.description:
The grammatical case.

The number should be among the values of Case Case

params.name: form
params.description:
The grammatical form.

The number should be among the values of Form Form

params.name: gender
params.description:
The grammatical gender.

The number should be among the values of Gender Gender

params.name: mood
params.description:
The grammatical mood.

The number should be among the values of Mood Mood

params.name: number
params.description:
The grammatical number.

The number should be among the values of Number Number

params.name: person
params.description:
The grammatical person.

The number should be among the values of Person Person

params.name: proper
params.description:
The grammatical properness.

The number should be among the values of Proper Proper

params.name: reciprocity
params.description:
The grammatical reciprocity.

The number should be among the values of Reciprocity Reciprocity

params.name: tense
params.description:
The grammatical tense.

The number should be among the values of Tense Tense

params.name: voice
params.description:
The grammatical voice.

The number should be among the values of Voice Voice

methods.name: Tag
methods.description: The part of speech tags enum.

methods.name: Aspect
methods.description: The characteristic of a verb that expresses time flow during an event.

methods.name: Case
methods.description: The grammatical function performed by a noun or pronoun in a phrase, clause, or sentence. In some languages, other parts of speech, such as adjective and determiner, take case inflection in agreement with the noun.

methods.name: Form
methods.description: Depending on the language, Form can be categorizing different forms of verbs, adjectives, adverbs, etc. For example, categorizing inflected endings of verbs and adjectives or distinguishing between short and long forms of adjectives and participles

methods.name: Gender
methods.description: Gender classes of nouns reflected in the behaviour of associated words.

methods.name: Mood
methods.description: The grammatical feature of verbs, used for showing modality and attitude.

methods.name: Number
methods.description: Count distinctions.

methods.name: Person
methods.description: The distinction between the speaker, second person, third person, etc.

methods.name: Proper
methods.description: This category shows if the token is part of a proper name.

methods.name: Reciprocity
methods.description: Reciprocal features of a pronoun.

methods.name: Tense
methods.description: Time reference.

methods.name: Voice
methods.description: The relationship between the action that a verb expresses and the participants identified by its arguments.

methods.name: DependencyEdge
methods.description: Represents dependency parse tree information for a token. (For more information on dependency labels, see http://www.aclweb.org/anthology/P13-2017

params.name: headTokenIndex
params.description: Represents the head of this token in the dependency tree. This is the index of the token which has an arc going to this token. The index is the position of the token in the array of tokens returned by the API method. If this token is a root token, then the head_token_index is its own index.

params.name: label
params.description:
The parse label for the token.

The number should be among the values of Label Label

methods.name: Label
methods.description: The parse label enum for the token.

methods.name: EntityMention
methods.description: Represents a mention for an entity in the text. Currently, proper noun mentions are supported.

params.name: text
params.description:
The mention text.

This object should have the same structure as TextSpan TextSpan

params.name: type
params.description:
The type of the entity mention.

The number should be among the values of Type Type

params.name: sentiment
params.description:
For calls to {@link AnalyzeEntitySentiment} or if {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entity_sentiment} is set to true, this field will contain the sentiment expressed for this mention of the entity in the provided document.

This object should have the same structure as Sentiment Sentiment

methods.name: TextSpan
methods.description: Represents an output piece of text.

params.name: content
params.description: The content of the output text.

params.name: beginOffset
params.description: The API calculates the beginning offset of the content in the original document according to the {@link EncodingType} specified in the API request.

params.name: document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate sentence offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: documentSentiment
params.description:
The overall sentiment of the input document.

This object should have the same structure as Sentiment Sentiment

params.name: language
params.description: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See {@link Document.language} field for more details.

params.name: sentences
params.description:
The sentiment for all the sentences in the document.

This object should have the same structure as Sentence Sentence

params.name: document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: entities
params.description:
The recognized entities in the input document with associated sentiments.

This object should have the same structure as Entity Entity

params.name: language
params.description: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See {@link Document.language} field for more details.

params.name: document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: entities
params.description:
The recognized entities in the input document.

This object should have the same structure as Entity Entity

params.name: language
params.description: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See {@link Document.language} field for more details.

params.name: document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

params.name: sentences
params.description:
Sentences in the input document.

This object should have the same structure as Sentence Sentence

params.name: tokens
params.description:
Tokens, along with their syntactic information, in the input document.

This object should have the same structure as Token Token

params.name: language
params.description: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See {@link Document.language} field for more details.

params.name: document
params.description:
Input document.

This object should have the same structure as Document Document

params.name: features
params.description:
The enabled features.

This object should have the same structure as Features Features

params.name: encodingType
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

The number should be among the values of EncodingType EncodingType

methods.name: Features
methods.description: All available features for sentiment, syntax, and semantic analysis. Setting each one to true will enable that specific analysis for the input.

params.name: extractSyntax
params.description: Extract syntax information.

params.name: extractEntities
params.description: Extract entities.

params.name: extractDocumentSentiment
params.description: Extract document-level sentiment.

params.name: extractEntitySentiment
params.description: Extract entities and their associated sentiment.

params.name: sentences
params.description:
Sentences in the input document. Populated if the user enables {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax}.

This object should have the same structure as Sentence Sentence

params.name: tokens
params.description:
Tokens, along with their syntactic information, in the input document. Populated if the user enables {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax}.

This object should have the same structure as Token Token

params.name: entities
params.description:
Entities, along with their semantic information, in the input document. Populated if the user enables {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entities}.

This object should have the same structure as Entity Entity

params.name: documentSentiment
params.description:
The overall sentiment for the document. Populated if the user enables {@link AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment}.

This object should have the same structure as Sentiment Sentiment

params.name: language
params.description: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See {@link Document.language} field for more details.

methods.name: EncodingType
methods.description: Represents the text encoding that the caller uses to process the output. Providing an EncodingType is recommended because the API provides the beginning offsets for various outputs, such as tokens and mentions, and languages that natively use different text encodings may access offsets differently.

description:
Class Description
{{method.name}} {{method.description}} The request for {{method.name}}. The response for {{method.name}}.
